title: LIC: LIC Launches State-of-the-Art Testing Centre in Bhubaneswar to Revolutionize Insurance Claims Process | Bhubaneswar News - Times of India
text: Bhubaneswar: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) of India inaugurated a testing centre of excellence (TCoE) in information technology at Surya Nagar in Bhubaneswar on Thursday. While inaugurating the facility, Siddhartha Mohanty, CEO of LIC, said the centre is equipped with modern tools, including cutting-edge automation technologies that will simplify the insurance claims process.“The deployment of these advanced technologies will ensure greater efficiency, accuracy, and faster turnaround times in business processes, thereby enhancing customer service. This centre is the first of its kind in the east-central zone of LIC,” said Siddhartha.Officials said this high-tech centre will initially be staffed by 100 IT experts and professionals from LIC and other external agencies. “Given Bhubaneswar’s rapid growth as a digital technology hub in the country, we are committed to continuously improving and expanding the centre into a major information technology hub for LIC,” said Siddhartha.We also published the following articles recentlyBonfiglioli lays foundation stone for Cheyyar plant, opens global technology centre in ChennaiBonfiglioli Transmissions' new 25-acre facility in Cheyyar, Tamil Nadu, slated for a 2025 opening, aims to bolster India's gearbox manufacturing capacity. The site will generate up to 200 jobs and meet rising domestic demand. Additionally, their Chennai-based Bonfiglioli Technology Space will focus on R&D with 180 engineers, emphasizing the company's commitment to innovation and growth.114324326Centre, Gujarat join hands for enhanced digital connectivityA Memorandum of Cooperation between India's Central and Gujarat governments will channel Rs 6,000 crore from the Universal Service Obligation Fund to Gujarat's science and technology department. The funding aims to enhance fiber optic connectivity, benefiting over 14,000 e-Gram centres and improving internet access in schools, health centres, police posts, and other key locations under the BharatNet phase-3 program.114292966Min to launch centre of excellence in ayurvedaUnion minister Jitendra Singh will lay the foundation for a Centre of Excellence in Ayurveda Research at CSIR-NIIST, aiming to enhance global outreach and compliance with international standards.
